To support the raising of Karelian question and support in peacefull returning of karelia as part of Finland as depicted in Peace of Tartu ( http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Treaty_of_Tartu_%28Russian%E2%80%93Finnish%29 ), please sign this plea. ( http://www.adressit.com/karjala_takaisin ) It explains in short how to add your name and sites where you can find more info regarding this issue. This is in no means radical movement or such, merely a demonstration of will to solve this issue once and for all.

Yes it was, very bloody war and amazingly, Finland survived with 1/10 of casualties compared to Soviet Union.

The Soviets lost between 800,000-1,000,000 men,
that equals 1/27 - 1/33 .. not 1/10 as you say ;)

Heh, yeah, but I meant at least 1/10, as the number is not certain. Just like with the Stalins political cleans, it is estimated that there could be even 50 million victims instead of 15 - 25 million.

For dere Nordmenn som forherliger deres patetiske krigsinnsats og tilber speiderguttene Max Manus og "Kjakan" Sønsteby se på dette. Slik som dette forsvarer ett folk og dens regjering sitt land.

Can anyone suggest other documentaries or movies on the Finnish Winter War? I have watched Talvisota and Ihantala-Tali. Good movies, Ihantala-Tali doesn´t really get under the skin of the soldier. How about books?

If you're interested in a book, William R. Trotter's "Frozen Hell" is excellent.

As for Soviet casualty figures, "we lost a million men" was hyperbole by Khrutschev. The estimates for dead Soviets go from 85,000 to 270,000, and of course loads of starved, maimed and frozen men.

Leesan this is reference to your inquiry about older version. It's not a doc but a film. Here is the poop on it from IMDB: Cheers r2d6

Plot Summary for
The Winter War (1989) More at IMDbPro »
Talvisota (original title)

ad feedback

Russia attacked Finland in late November 1939. This film tells the story of a Finnish platoon of reservists from the municipality of Kauhava in the province of Pohjanmaa/Ostrobothnia who leave their homes and go to war. The film focuses on the farmer brothers Martti and Paavo Hakala
